intro: Anthistiria imberbis var. roylei, commonly known as the Kashmir Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
